Description: Lip and wall sherd of East Greek (North Ionian or Aiolian) pottery bowl; orange clay with much silver mica; interior: dark brown glaze with worn painted lines; exterior: top of lip glazed; set of verticals in frieze; inscription cut on exterior.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 300)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 668, no. 261)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.594)
